forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 7 to 10 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South wind 10 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the heart of Downtown San Francisco, the afternoon unfolds under a canopy of muted clouds, gentle reminders of the chill that will soon settle in as temperatures dip to a more nippy 55 degrees. The south-southwest breeze, a whispering companion, makes its presence known, rustling through the streets like a tune half-remembered. As the day wears on, this mostly overcast sky gives a glimpse of the rain forecasted to arrive after dusk, a promise of refreshment for the weary earth. Through the haze, the outlines of the city emerge, each building a silhouette melding into the roiling sky above; the Golden Gate Bridge, though shrouded, commands attention like an artist’s brushstroke, defining the view with its iconic posture.

As night falls, the weather leans into the damp embrace of impending rain, with an urgency that hints at unspent energies in the air. Those venturing out should consider a light jacket, perhaps layered over a cozy sweater, for warmth against the cooler winds. Perhaps an umbrella, too, just in case the clouds decide to spill their secrets, as the chance of precipitation is high. Encounters with the elements could beckon a leisurely stroll under the soft glow of street lamps or a moment to cozy up with coffee in a local café, where one can admire the rhythm of the city while relishing the mingling scents of roasted beans and rain-soaked earth. In these moments, even an overcast day can transform into something unexpectedly delightful, inviting contemplation and connection amid the gray.
